allTitles: {"en":"About Coronavirus","pkb":"Kuhusu virusi vya ug’onjo wa Korona"}

0.pkb: Kuhusu virusi vya ug’onjo wa Korona

2.pkb: Translated by Mr. Gafo Hiribae Suleiman & Mr. Kenneth Yakko Galana

4.eng: There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus
4.pkb: Vya lombolo MOJA d’oku ambadyo kwafed’ekanani umanye  kuhusu e bifa ambayo virusi vya ug’onjo wa korona

12.pkb: E virusi avyo vyaddach’aa kona e mahwente yano

13.eng: Keep your distance.﻿2m to 0.5m will keep you safe from large droplets.
13.pkb: Kaiya kuwe. Mita mbili zakuwezesha usepata mahwente makuyu

17.eng: So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:
17.pkb: Ddubha kona kuona muntu kakololani/kabigani myasa/ni mug’onjo unaweza ukaamua ku:

18.eng: Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby
18.pkb: Waphe kib’aiko kya kukingiliza e mpuya ne miyomo. Waweza kukolola au kubiga myasa mude mwe kib’aiko na wawakinge wade wotte waiyo hafuphi nao

22.eng: Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself

23.eng: People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious
23.pkb: Wantu ambao wakiziywa e ug’onjo ao waweza kuseyagiza d’alili zidezonchi, amo amale waweza kukizia wantu wangine.

24.eng: And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.
24.pkb: Na kwa j’umula, ni vijure zaid’i kujifyula na ttutta ya wantu, koro nkuji kwamba aiye mug’onjo ni ga.

25.pkb: Vijihi vya kuyavia uchafu wa magego

28.pkb: Vifod’onko ambavyo vyaminywa ili wantu waphae juyu na ngazi ya sitima

32.eng: & even on the outside of your face mask
32.pkb: Na hatta battini ye kib’aiko kyako kye uso

33.pkb: Nguzo za ngazi kona kwaphayani d’arini

34.pkb:
Kifaa kiikyo
bifa ya mpanya kyatumika kwa kompyuta

38.eng: However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…
38.pkb: Cha javyavyo, saa zingine mahe ya muntu mug’onjo yaweza kufikia  visaga vingine…

40.pkb: au e uso wa yude umujamiyeo

42.eng: And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,
42.pkb: Na kona kuddaba kisaga kimoja kahi ya avyo b’ila ya kumanya, kisa ujiddabe e uso,

43.eng: and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.
43.pkb:
na e ngia njure zaid’i ya kuvinusa e virusi
avyo ni kuvikosa uviyavye na sab’uni, ddawa ya kuyaga viini vya mag’onjo au utumie ddawa iiyo na tembo.

44.eng: Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,
44.pkb: Virusi vya uwezo wa kukaya rigo juyu ya visaga kwa masaa kachuchu

47.eng: Which is why it is also good to follow these
47.pkb: Ndo maana ni vijure pia kuyuba e maag’izo yano

48.eng: wash with soap up to here

51.eng: Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.
51.pkb: Manya usejiddaba e uso. (Au uso wa yudeywonchi.) Kona ni haddi uuddabe, ikose nguzi e mikono yako na sab’uni, ikose na kuigagalia.

52.eng: Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice
52.pkb: Mala ya kwamba unaweza ukakwimba e wiya ude wa “Mwana Mujongosi” mara mbili

56.eng: wash the back of your hands
56.pkb: Kosa e mongo we maganja yako

58.eng: If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.
58.pkb: Kona kuddaba, sijoj’ali. Awe kosa e mikono yako na sab’uni b’aad’a ya kuhenda ja avyo.

59.eng: Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.
59.pkb: Pia, manya kuddaba e battini ye kibaiko kyako kona unad’una.

61.eng: *Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long
61.pkb: Viini vya bakiteria ambavyo vyasab’ab’isha mag’onjo vyamea kizimu ye kib’aiko kyako kona kukivwaya kwa mud’a mulela sana

62.eng: Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!
62.pkb: Fattula e vib’aiko kona vikaya bifa zuka. Manya kuvivwaya zaid’i ya siku moja!

67.pkb: Kila mumoja awe na tauli yakwe

68.eng: Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.
68.pkb: Manya kudya sahani moja na muntu, au kutumia phamojani visaga vya jikoni, au kutumia tauli phamoja.

69.eng: You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried
69.pkb: Kuwezi kujiddaba e uso ne kikorhokorho kyako hatta kud’ema

70.eng: Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.
70.pkb: Funga na kufunguya midyango ne vikorhokorho au vitturo vyako b’ad’ili ye mikono, kona yawezekana.

72.eng: and after being out in the public
72.pkb: Na b’aad’a ya kuyawa na bia ya wantu wangine

74.eng: Always wash your hands with soap…
74.pkb: Kosa e mikono yako na sab’uni saa zo badda chwe…

80.eng: Read the articles for more tips!
80.pkb: Soma e vitab’u avyo upate maelezo zaid’i!

81.eng: "This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel" by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)
81.pkb: "This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel" by Chia yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)

82.eng: "The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe", by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign Policy, Report. (Jan 25, 2020)
82.pkb: "The wuhan Virus: How to stay safe", by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign Policy, Report. (Jan 25, 2020)

83.eng: "How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands", by Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, Opinion. (Jan 28, 2020
83.pkb: "How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands", by Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, Opinion.  (Jan 28, 2020)

84.pkb: Bia maalumu ambazo unaweza kupata odhu za kimattib’ab’u

85.eng:
Additional notes:  Hygiene precautions in comic are effective in preventing many other common infections such as flu and cold, and should be applied in every day life, even when there is no epidemic. 
References:  lnformation in comic is based on understanding of COVI 019 up till 28 Feb 2020, and mainly from these three references. ﻿https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/ ﻿https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-1O
Additonal lnformation  A PDF version of the comic is available for free download here:﻿﻿https://gumroad.com/weimankowart 
Sharing Guidelines  This comic is free for the general public to share online and through Whatsapp and Telegram, and the downloads are free for printing out as posters for personal and educational use in homes, schools, and workplaces. 
When sharing, please remember these 3 points: ﻿1) No edits to the comics is allowed in any way when sharing.﻿2) Comics cannot be used for any commercial project﻿3) lf online, credit the creator on FB by tagging @weimankowart, on IG by tagging @weimankow (IG), or providing a link to instagram com/weimankow
﻿For all other uses, please send a request in to: comicsforgood@gmail.com
85.pkb:
Maelezo zaid’i: Maag’izo ya usafi katika e vitab’u vino ambavyo vya mapicha na maelezo yakwe vyasaid’ia sana katika kukingiliza aina zingine nyingi za mag’onjo ya kukizia, ja kongo na k’anano, na ni haddi yatumike katika maisha ya kila siku; hatta kona havi mulipuko wa ug’onjo.
References: lnformation in comic is based on understanding of COVID19 up till 28 Feb 2020, and mainly from these three references.  https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/  https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10

bookText.eng:
About Coronavirus



There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus
SPREADS
Mouth
Nose
Eyes
Get into your
Healthy Person
Sick Person
The virus spreads when ﻿these droplets
Keep your distance.﻿2m to 0.5m will keep you safe from large droplets.
1
2m-0.5m
Achoo!
So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:
Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby
2
Thank you﻿*sniffles*
OR,
Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself
People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious
And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.
chopsticks
Healthy person
Train straps
Lift buttons
Tissues
Cups
Digital devices
& even on the outside of your face mask
Stair bannisters
Mouse
Pens
Door knobs
Their hands
However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…
you might all fall sick.
or your loved one's face
rub eyes
And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,
and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.
Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,
soap
precautions
Which is why it is also good to follow these
wash with soap up to here
soap
elbow
Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.
Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice
under the nails
for 20 seconds
between the fingers
wash the back of your hands
What is thoroughly?
If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.
Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.
droplets
*Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long
Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!
Use a serving spoon
Baby
Daddy
Mommy
Everyone gets their own towel
Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.
You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried
Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.
Home
and after being out in the public
Before you eat
Always wash your hands with soap…
And finally,
soap
Stay safe, everyone!
Stay safe, everyone!
soap
Read the articles for more tips!

bookText.pkb:
Kuhusu virusi vya ug’onjo wa Korona

Translated by Mr. Gafo Hiribae Suleiman & Mr. Kenneth Yakko Galana

Vya lombolo MOJA d’oku ambadyo kwafed’ekanani umanye  kuhusu e bifa ambayo virusi vya ug’onjo wa korona
VYADDACH’AA
Miyomoni
Mpuyani
Machoni
Yakungia amwo
Muntu aiye fayuma
Muntu mug’onjo
E virusi avyo vyaddach’aa kona e mahwente yano
Kaiya kuwe. Mita mbili zakuwezesha usepata mahwente makuyu
1
Mita mbili
Kohoo!
Ddubha kona kuona muntu kakololani/kabigani myasa/ni mug’onjo unaweza ukaamua ku:
Waphe kib’aiko kya kukingiliza e mpuya ne miyomo. Waweza kukolola au kubiga myasa mude mwe kib’aiko na wawakinge wade wotte waiyo hafuphi nao

Asantta *vittambaa vya kubigia myasa
*
AU
Phangine sapha mug’onjo, kajikingani b’asi.
Wantu ambao wakiziywa e ug’onjo ao waweza kuseyagiza d’alili zidezonchi, amo amale waweza kukizia wantu wangine.
Na kwa j’umula, ni vijure zaid’i kujifyula na ttutta ya wantu, koro nkuji kwamba aiye mug’onjo ni ga.
Vijihi vya kuyavia uchafu wa magego
Muntu aiye fayuma
Nkanda za g’ari ya moshi
Vifod’onko ambavyo vyaminywa ili wantu waphae juyu na ngazi ya sitima
Vikarattasi vya kuphangusia mikono
Vikombe
Visaga vyatumia mitandao
Na hatta battini ye kib’aiko kyako kye uso
Nguzo za ngazi kona kwaphayani d’arini
Kifaa kiikyo
bifa ya mpanya kyatumika kwa kompyuta
Kalamu
Piki za midyango
E mikono yao
Cha javyavyo, saa zingine mahe ya muntu mug’onjo yaweza kufikia  visaga vingine…
mwaweza kuhenda wag’onjo nyotte 
au e uso wa yude umujamiyeo
ujiphokoche e macho
Na kona kuddaba kisaga kimoja kahi ya avyo b’ila ya kumanya, kisa ujiddabe e uso,
na e ngia njure zaid’i ya kuvinusa e virusi
avyo ni kuvikosa uviyavye na sab’uni, ddawa ya kuyaga viini vya mag’onjo au utumie ddawa iiyo na tembo.
Virusi vya uwezo wa kukaya rigo juyu ya visaga kwa masaa kachuchu
Sab’uni

Ndo maana ni vijure pia kuyuba e maag’izo yano
Kosa na sab’uni
mupaka phano
Sab’uni
Kikorhokorho
Manya usejiddaba e uso. (Au uso wa yudeywonchi.) Kona ni haddi uuddabe, ikose nguzi e mikono yako na sab’uni, ikose na kuigagalia.
Mala ya kwamba unaweza ukakwimba e wiya ude wa “Mwana Mujongosi” mara mbili
mude nyayani
kwa sekunde miongo miwili
Kahi ye mad’oe
Kosa e mongo we maganja yako
Kukosa na kugagalia imaanisha nkega?
Kona kuddaba, sijoj’ali. Awe kosa e mikono yako na sab’uni b’aad’a ya kuhenda ja avyo.
Pia, manya kuddaba e battini ye kibaiko kyako kona unad’una.
mahwente  
Viini vya bakiteria ambavyo vyasab’ab’isha mag’onjo vyamea kizimu ye kib’aiko kyako kona kukivwaya kwa mud’a mulela sana
Fattula e vib’aiko kona vikaya bifa zuka. Manya kuvivwaya zaid’i ya siku moja!
Tumia kij’iko kya kumolea vintu
Mwana
Baba
Mama
Kila mumoja awe na tauli yakwe
Manya kudya sahani moja na muntu, au kutumia phamojani visaga vya jikoni, au kutumia tauli phamoja.
Kuwezi kujiddaba e uso ne kikorhokorho kyako hatta kud’ema
Funga na kufunguya midyango ne vikorhokorho au vitturo vyako b’ad’ili ye mikono, kona yawezekana.
Nyumbani
Na b’aad’a ya kuyawa na bia ya wantu wangine
Kab’ula nkujanadya
Kosa e mikono yako na sab’uni saa zo badda chwe…
Na mwiso,
Sab’uni
Kila muntu akae salama!
Kila muntu akae salama!
Sab’uni
Soma e vitab’u avyo upate maelezo zaid’i!
"This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel" by Chia yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)
"The wuhan Virus: How to stay safe", by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign Policy, Report. (Jan 25, 2020)
"How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands", by Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, Opinion.  (Jan 28, 2020)
Bia maalumu ambazo unaweza kupata odhu za kimattib’ab’u
Maelezo zaid’i: Maag’izo ya usafi katika e vitab’u vino ambavyo vya mapicha na maelezo yakwe vyasaid’ia sana katika kukingiliza aina zingine nyingi za mag’onjo ya kukizia, ja kongo na k’anano, na ni haddi yatumike katika maisha ya kila siku; hatta kona havi mulipuko wa ug’onjo.
References: lnformation in comic is based on understanding of COVID19 up till 28 Feb 2020, and mainly from these three references.  https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/  https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10

Sharing Guidelines This comic is free for the general public to share online and through Whatsapp and Telegram, and the downloads are free for printing out as posters for personal and educational use in homes, schools, and workplaces. 
When sharing, please remember these 3 points: 1) No edits to the comics is allowed in any way when sharing. 2) Comics cannot be used for any commercial project 3) lf online, credit the creator on FB by tagging @weimankowart, on IG by tagging @weimankow (IG), or providing a link to instagram com/weimankow
